snippet: Claire Cain Miller reports in Monday's New York Times how Google and other tech companies are experimenting with what's known as ubiquitous computing or intelligence augmentation - the idea that computers will no longer be devices we turn on, but...
abstract: Claire Cain Miller reports in Monday's New York Times how Google and other tech companies are experimenting with what's known as ubiquitous computing or intelligence augmentation - the idea that computers will no longer be devices we turn on, but will be so integrated into our everyday environment that we can ask them to do things without ever lifting a finger.

headline.main: Daily Report: Joining the Party, Not Crashing It
